spanGrp.span: This language is similar to Turkish, we speak it from childhood as our grandparents were speaking and we learned it.
aa bu dili šindi biz angısi ki turetskiya biräz bänzir ee söilirıh küčük ikändän onučun ki bizım deduškamızda babamızda biz bizi büläni bu dilınän bizınän söilirlär i bizda alıštıh bu dili

But besides that we normally speak Russian too, we do not want to lose this either, as many languages you know the better it is.
ama krome etava ahnayah ävımızdä söilirıh urusča dilınän onučun ki istämirıh o itıräh bunidä istirıh nähärtän čoğ dil bülsäh ohärtän eydır

but besides this:SG.M/N.GEN necessary house -POSS.1.PL -LOC speak -AOR -1.PL Russian language -INSTR because that want -NEG -AOR -1.PL that loose -INF this -ACC -and want -AOR -1.PL as.much many language know -COND -1.PL so.much good -EPST.COP
At the moment we don’t have Russian sector at school, when Georgian was opened Russian was closed.
ee školada ee danni mament russki sector yohtur onučun ki näki gürjüjä ačıldi russkii kitlädılär
HESIT school:SG.F.NOM -LOC HESIT present moment:SG.M.NOM russian:SG.M.NOM sector:SG.M.NOM NEG.EXIST -EPST.COP because that what -COMP Georgian open -PASS -PST russian:SG.M.NOM close -PST -PL
We study in Georgian and we also know Russian language, some Urum and Georgian people do not know this language.
äp ohirıh biz na gruzinskom yazıke bülirıh o gruzinski yazıgidä ešyo šei urusča dil elä olir ki bizım urum halh nu gürji halh bülmir bu dili čoği aa čoği bülir

all study -AOR -1.PL 1.PL to Georgian:SG.M.PREP language:SG.M.PREP know -AOR -1.PL that Georgian:SG.M.NOM language:SG:M:NOM -ACC -and yet that Russian language so be -AOR that 1.PL -GEN Urum people well Georgian people know -NEG -AOR this language -ACC many HESIT many know -AOR
We have learned Russian from TV that we are usually watching.
biz bülirıh ordan ki bahirıh urusča televidenya urusča äriš urusča bahirıh oki bunnari görirıh alıšerıh
1.PL know -AOR -1.PL there -ABL that look -AOR -1.PL Russian TV:SG.F.NOM Russian everything Russian look -AOR -1.PL when this -PL -ACC see -AOR -1.PL learn -IPFV -1.PL
My grandparents speak Russian, so my brothers and I are interested in it, then we teach it to our friends so they will know it too.
bizım deduškalarımız babuškalarımız söilirlär urusča interesavatsa edirıh bändä bänım ğardašlarımda šei edirıh soradan alıštırerıh bizım arkadašlarımızi ki onnarda bülä urusča

For me Russian language is a great language.
nu bänä öčüri russki yazık čoğ važnidır eta eta veliki yazık bu rassiaya čoğ böyuk yazıktır

well 1.SG -DAT for russian:SG.M.NOM language:SG:M:NOM very important:SG.M.NOM -EPST.COP this:SG.F.NOM this:SG.F.NOM great:SG.M.NOM language:SG:M:NOM this Russia:SG.F.NOM -DAT very big language:SG:M:NOM -EPST.COP
I think that the more people that know this language the better it is, speech is a necessity in life.
bän bän zänedirım ki bu dili nähärtän čoğ adam bülsä ohärtän eydır onučun ki ahnayah lazım gävır yašamahta
